result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Not all discovery has been received. Offer received.  Attorney Mahmood request more time to review offer with defendant, he was not able to contact him.  The defendant provided his updated address and phone number.  Request additional Scheduling Conference.

Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia.

Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

11:26 AM Prosecuting attorney Rebecca Meyer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Don Demetris Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Don Demetris Williams. Defendant advised of rights. Received complaint/waived reading. NG Plea entered. Probable cause found in the complaint. Bond set.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
